conclusion: Analyze the paths of the liquids from points A, B, C, and D to determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into.
The liquid flows downward from A.
The liquid from A encounters a pink baffle that directs it to the right.
The liquid from A continues downward and flows into container E.
The liquid flows downward from B.
The liquid from B encounters a green baffle that directs it to the left.
The liquid from B continues downward and flows into container F.
The liquid flows downward from C.
The liquid from C encounters a white baffle that directs it to the right.
The liquid from C continues downward and flows into container E.
The liquid flows downward from D.
The liquid from D encounters a white baffle that directs it to the left.
The liquid from D continues downward and flows into container F.
Liquids from A and C flow into container E.
Liquids from B and D flow into container F.
Container E will receive liquid from A and C.
Container F will receive liquid from B and D.
